benefits.title: Berberine: a potential phytochemical with multispectrum therapeutic activities
benefits.summary: Berberine has potential therapeutic activities in treating chronic ailments like diabetes, cancer, depression, hypertension, and hypercholesterolemia.

benefits.title: Berberine, a Natural Plant Product, Activates AMP-Activated Protein Kinase With Beneficial Metabolic Effects in Diabetic and Insulin-Resistant States
benefits.summary: Berberine reduces body weight, improves glucose tolerance, and improves insulin action in diabetic and insulin-resistant states.

benefits.title: Berberine: a plant alkaloid with therapeutic potential for central nervous system disorders
benefits.summary: Berberine has a protective effect in Alzheimer's, cerebral ischemia, mental depression, schizophrenia, and anxiety.

benefits.title: Berberine mitigates cognitive decline in an Alzheimer's Disease Mouse Model by targeting both tau hyperphosphorylation and autophagic clearance.
benefits.summary: Berberine improves spatial learning capacity and memory retentions in Alzheimer's disease mice by targeting tau hyperphosphorylation and autophagic clearance.

benefits.title: Berberine as a Potential Anticancer Agent: A Comprehensive Review
benefits.summary: Berberine has remarkable health benefits, including its potential anticancer activity, which prevents cancer cell proliferation, hinders tumor cell invasion, and reduces epithelial-mesenchymal transition protein expression.

benefits.title: Modulations of cytochrome P450 expression in diabetic mice by berberine.
benefits.summary: Berberine has the potential to modify the expression of CYPs, potentially providing an extra benefit for diabetic patients by restoring Cyp2e1, Cyp3a, and Cyp4a to normal levels.

benefits.title: Berberine regulates melanin synthesis by activating PI3K/AKT, ERK and GSK3β in B16F10 melanoma cells.
benefits.summary: Berberine inhibits melanin synthesis and tyrosinase activity, potentially helping in the prevention and treatment of skin pigmentation disorders.

benefits.title: Berberine and neurodegeneration: A review of literature.
benefits.summary: Berberine has therapeutic potential in neurodegenerative diseases like Alzheimer, Parkinson, and Huntington disease due to its powerful antioxidant effect.

benefits.title: Role of berberine in Alzheimer’s disease
benefits.summary: Berberine may be beneficial to Alzheimer's disease by limiting the pathogenesis of amyloid plaques and neurofibrillary tangles, and inhibiting risk factors for the disease.

benefits.title: Berberine was neuroprotective against an in vitro model of brain ischemia: Survival and apoptosis pathways involved
benefits.summary: Berberine protects against delayed neuronal cell death in an in vitro model of brain ischemia, involving the Akt/GSK3Î±/ERK1/2 survival/apoptotic signaling pathway and JNK and caspase-3 activity inhibition.

side effects.title: Lipid-lowering effect of berberine in human subjects and rats.
side effects.summary: Berberine treatment produced mild weight loss and significantly reduced blood lipid levels, with no detrimental side effects observed in hematological, cardiovascular, liver, and kidney function tests.
side effects.journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology

side effects.title: Neurotoxic effects of berberine on long-term l-DOPA administration in 6-hydroxydopamine-lesioned rat model of Parkinson’s disease
side effects.summary: Berberine leads to the degeneration of dopaminergic neuronal cells in the substantia nigra in a rat model of Parkinson's disease with chronic l-DOPA administration.

side effects.title: Anticancer Effects and Mechanisms of Berberine from Medicinal Herbs: An Update Review
side effects.summary: Side effects of berberine include inhibiting cancer cell proliferation, suppressing metastasis, inducing apoptosis, activating autophagy, regulating gut microbiota, and improving the effects of anticancer drugs.

side effects.title: Berberine and barberry (Berberis vulgaris): A clinical review
side effects.summary: Mild gastrointestinal reactions may occur in some patients when taking berberine at usual doses.

side effects.title: Potential Benefits of Berberine in the Management of Perimenopausal Syndrome
side effects.summary: Berberine can decrease oxidative stress, LDL, triglycerides, and insulin resistance, and improve mood.

side effects.title: Berberine Is a Promising Alkaloid to Attenuate Iron Toxicity Efficiently in Iron-Overloaded Mice
side effects.summary: Berberine reduced iron sedimentation in all tissues and lowered clinical symptoms of iron overdose, including inflammation, fibrosis, and tissue degeneration.

side effects.title: Berberine diminishes the side population and ABCG2 transporter expression in MCF-7 breast cancer cells.
side effects.summary: Berberine treatment reduces proliferation and side population cells in MCF-7 breast cancer cells, potentially targeting breast cancer stem cells.

side effects.title: Role of a berberine-based nutritional supplement in reducing diarrhea in subjects with functional gastrointestinal disorders.
side effects.summary: Common side effects of berberine-based products include flatulence and meteorism.

side effects.title: Berberine Effects on NFκB, HIF1A and NFE2L2/AP-1 Pathways in HeLa Cells.
side effects.summary: Higher concentrations of berberine cause severe signaling side-effects in the HIF1A and NFE2L2/AP-1 pathways, jeopardizing its clinical value.

side effects.title: Protective effect of berberine on serum glucose levels in non-obese diabetic mice.
side effects.summary: Berberine supplemented at appropriate doses for 14 weeks did not cause toxic side effects, but improved hyperglycemia in non-obese diabetic mice.

dosage.title: Berberine inhibits Rho GTPases and cell migration at low doses but induces G2 arrest and apoptosis at high doses in human cancer cells.
dosage.summary: High doses of berberine (>150 microM) induce mitotic arrest and apoptosis in human cancer cells.

dosage.title: In vivo anticoccidial activity of berberine [18, 5,6-dihydro-9,10-dimethoxybenzo(g)-1,3-benzodioxolo(5,6-a) quinolizinium]--an isoquinoline alkaloid present in the root bark of Berberis lycium.
dosage.summary: The highest anticoccidial activity of berberine was tested at 300 mg/kg body weight, and it was not lethal up to a dosage of 2000 mg/kg body weight.
dosage.journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology

dosage.title: The Evaluation of Pro-Cognitive and Antiamnestic Properties of Berberine and Magnoflorine Isolated from Barberry Species by Centrifugal Partition Chromatography (CPC), in Relation to QSAR Modelling
dosage.summary: Cognition enhancing properties of berberine were observed at doses of 5 mg/kg (i.p.) for berberine and 20 mg/kg (i.p.) for magnoflorine.

dosage.title: Novel Effect of Berberine on Thermoregulation in Mice Model Induced by Hot and Cold Environmental Stimulation
dosage.summary: The dosages of berberine used in this study were 0.2, 0.4, and 0.8 mg/kg.

dosage.title: Hepatobiliary excretion of berberine.
dosage.summary: Berberine has a linear pharmacokinetic phenomenon in the dosage range from 10 to 20 mg kg(-1).
dosage.journal: Drug metabolism and disposition: the biological fate of chemicals

dosage.title: [Effects of berberine on serum levels of inflammatory factors and inflammatory signaling pathway in obese mice induced by high fat diet].
dosage.summary: Berberine at dosages of 50 mg x kg(-1) and 150 mg x kg(-1) improves glucose tolerance and reduces body weight in obese mice.
dosage.journal: Zhongguo Zhong yao za zhi = Zhongguo zhongyao zazhi = China journal of Chinese materia medica

dosage.title: Effect of berberine on the blood concentration of cyclosporine A in the renal transplant recipients
dosage.summary: The dosage of berberine in this study was 0.2g each time, 3 times per day.

dosage.title: Evaluation of the Effect of Alkaloid Berberine on the Positive and Negative Symptoms of the Patients with Schizophrenia: A Double-Blind Randomized Placebo-Controlled Clinical Trial
dosage.summary: Alkaloid berberine at a dosage of 500 mg per day did not show better outcomes compared to the placebo in patients with schizophrenia.

dosage.title: Effects of Berberine on Cell Cycle, DNA, Reactive Oxygen Species, and Apoptosis in L929 Murine Fibroblast Cells
dosage.summary: High dosage of berberine (0.05 mg/mL) leads to cell cycle arrest, DNA damage, ROS accumulation, reduced mitochondrial membrane potential, and cell apoptosis in L929 murine fibroblast cells.
dosage.journal: Evidence-based Complementary and Alternative Medicine : eCAM

dosage.title: The effect of berberine chloride on experimental colitis in rats in vivo and in vitro.
dosage.summary: Berberine was administered orally at a dosage of 7.5 or 15 mg/kg/day for 3 days or 1 week in rats.
dosage.journal: The Journal of pharmacology and experimental therapeutics
